metadata.title: CVE-2024-53065 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mm/slab: fix warning caused by duplicate kmem_cache creation inkmem_buckets_createCommit b035f5a6d852 ("mm: slab: reduce the kmalloc() minimum alignmentif DMA bouncing possible") reduced ARCH_KMALLOC_MINALIGN to 8 on arm64.However, with KASAN_HW_TAGS enabled, arch_slab_minalign() becomes 16.This causes kmalloc_caches[*][8] to be aliased to kmalloc_caches[*][16],resulting in kmem_buckets_create() attempting to create a kmem_cache forsize 16 twice. This duplication triggers warnings on boot:[    2.325108] ------------[ cut here ]------------[    2.325135] kmem_cache of name 'memdup_user-16' already exists[    2.325783] WARNING: CPU: 0 PID: 1 at mm/slab_common.c:107__kmem_cache_create_args+0xb8/0x3b0[    2.327957] Modules linked in:[    2.328550] CPU: 0 UID: 0 PID: 1 Comm: swapper/0 Not tainted6.12.0-rc5mm-unstable-arm64+ #12[    2.328683] Hardware name: QEMU QEMU Virtual Machine, BIOS 2024.02-203/11/2024[    2.328790] pstate: 61000009 (nZCv daif -PAN -UAO -TCO +DIT -SSBSBTYPE=--)[    2.328911] pc : __kmem_cache_create_args+0xb8/0x3b0[ x18:ffff800083d80030[    2.329135] x17: 0000000000000000 x16: 0000000000000000 x15:0000000000000000[    2.329152] x14: 0000000000000000 x13: 0a73747369786520 x12:79646165726c6120[    2.329169] x11: 656820747563205b x10: 2d2d2d2d2d2d2d2d x9 :0000000000000000[    2.329194] x8 : 0000000000000000 x7 : 0000000000000000 x6 :0000000000000000[    2.329210] x5 : 0000000000000000 x4 : 0000000000000000 x3 :0000000000000000[    2.329226] x2 : 0000000000000000 x1 : 0000000000000000 x0 :0000000000000000[    2.329291] Call trace:[    2.329407]  __kmem_cache_create_args+0xb8/0x3b0[    2.329499] 'msg_msg-16' already exists[    2.404801] WARNING: CPU: 2 PID: 1 at mm/slab_common.c:107__kmem_cache_create_args+0xb8/0x3b0[    2.404842] Modules linked in:[    2.404971] CPU: 2 UID: 0 PID: 1 Comm: swapper/0 Tainted: G        W     6.12.0-rc5mm-unstable-arm64+ #12[    2.405026] Tainted: [W]=WARN[    2.405043] Hardware name: QEMU QEMU Virtual Machine, BIOS 2024.02-203/11/2024[    2.405057]     Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-53065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16

linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
